content.webTitle: Joe Hart warns Manchester City of Leicester’s Jamie Vardy threat

fields.headline: Joe Hart warns Manchester City of Leicester’s Jamie Vardy threat
fields.bodyText: Joe Hart has said it is impossible to plan for the kind of goal Jamie Vardy scored against Liverpool, as the Manchester City goalkeeper prepares for Saturday’s top-of-the-table meeting with Leicester City at the Etihad Stadium. Vardy’s 60th-minute strike in Tuesday’s 2-0 victory left Simon Mignolet, the Liverpool goalkeeper, no chance of stopping it as the 29-year-old hit a first-time shot on the angle from 25 yards. Vardy also scored Leicester’s second to take him to 18 goals in the Premier League, making him the competition’s highest scorer this season. Leicester lead City by three points and Hart believes Vardy will pose a real threat. Hart said of the volley against Liverpool: “It’s a great goal and fully meant. That goal ultimately won Leicester the game. Their first of the game and it was a fantastic finish. We study the team we’re playing against and I watch football as a fan. I know how he scores his goals and his pattern of finishing but there’s only so much you can plan for a Saturday because I doubt anyone would have seen that goal coming. “I’m really happy for how the season has gone for him. He’s a fantastic player and a great guy. He’s really exploded. I think he’s just been more prolific. That’s the only thing that’s changed about him. Obviously, I didn’t know too much about him until Leicester were in the Premier League but we know what hard work and energy he brings and that he could really take up the time of the back four on his own. For me as a keeper it’s about knowing how he’ll chase every ball and now he’s added the finishing too. It’s priceless, really.” Hart is familiar with Vardy as the two are England colleagues. “He’s a good guy. I got him as soon as he walked through the door at England. I was obviously aware of him, having spoken to Kasper [Schmeichel, the Leicester goalkeeper], and was aware, having been at England for a long time, that he didn’t have any team-mates with him but he is exactly as he seems. He’s straight down the line. He is who he is and he’s a lot of fun to be around.” Hart believes Claudio Ranieri’s side will contend until the end of the season. “They more than deserve to be where they are at the moment,” he said. “If they keep that up they’re obviously going to be there or thereabouts. After the game on Saturday they’re done for us this season and then it’s all about what we do. Beating them is a statement that would only last until the following week when different statements are made.” Hart believes an unprecedented quadruple of Premier League, Champions League, FA Cup and League Cup remains possible. “The squad is going to be stretched if we’re going to achieve but what’s the point otherwise?” he said. “We’re going to have to dig in and get the bodies out when we can. We’re in a good moment and are going to have to keep going and cash in.”
